content.description:
Start as per

Make it Hurt

(10a), moving right into the ( (more) painful finger crack. The brief crux is on the obvious low bulge, with a good (sharp) crack but little else.  After that you encounter the same dirty ledge as

Make it Hurt

, where you finish up with a little more finger crack, this time with easy stemming.  Move left on slab to gear anchor.
content.protection:
Gear, mostly fingers.  Gear anchor at the top with the same slung boulder on top of

Make it Hurt

(10a).  The slings on the boulder are old.  Back them up.
content.location:
Shared start with

Make it Hurt

.  West face of the

Go West

formation.

content.description:
Awkward start leads to a left leaning finger crack through a short bulge.  After that the crack is discontinuous.  On a dirty ledge, multiple finishes are available.  Either finish the face to the left with sparse protection, or go right and finish the upper section of

Make It Hurt More

(11a).  Going right makes the route marginally harder, but still .10-
content.protection:
Gear- Standard rack with emphasis on hands and fingers.  It is reccomended(and fun) to perform a lasso-style placement with a sling and a large nut from the ground. Gear anchor at top, same location as

Make it Hurt More

.  A boulder is slung, but the slings are old.  Bring your own.

There is a walk off available, but it is difficult to find and definitely 4th class down-climbing.
content.location:
West side of the

Breadloaves

. Look for finger cracks through bulges, this is the left one.

content.description: A jumbled mix of discontinuous crack, featured bulge, and slab climbing.  A somewhat bouldery start on the west shoulder of the formation leads to easier climbing, then a strange leftward undercling traverse on more vertical terrain, followed by a delicate slab.
content.protection:
One bolt high,  plus very marginal gear.

If you plan to lead bring small cams and stoppers.  Best to toprope from a gear anchor above Make It Hurt(10a).

Gear Anchor
content.location:
25 feet left of

Make It Hurt (10a).
